title: The fall of Chiara Ferragni, Italy's queen of influencers
summary: The image of the Instagram star who once captivated Italy was tarnished at the end of last year. Convicted of fraudulent promotion, her fall from grace is fueled by Giorgia Meloni herself.

title: Four Moscow attack suspects charged with terrorism
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin has vowed to punish those behind the 'barbaric terrorist attack' and has claimed the four gunmen had been trying to flee to Ukraine.

title: UNRWA says Israel is barring all aid deliveries to famine-stricken northern Gaza
summary: The head of the agency says Israeli authorities are no longer approving food convoys headed to the area.

title: Senegal votes to elect its new president after weeks of uncertainty
summary: Nearly 7.3 million people are expected to go to the polls on Sunday. This eagerly-awaited vote comes after a month of unprecedented political crisis in the country, caused by the postponement of the election.

title: France raises security alert to highest level after Moscow attack
summary: The change came after French President Emmanuel Macron held an emergency security meeting, prompted by Friday's deadly attack.

title: Simon Harris set to become Ireland's youngest prime minister
summary: Harris became leader of the Fine Gael party on Sunday after he was the only candidate to put his name forward to succeed Leo Varadkar.

title: France promises evacuation flights for its 'most vulnerable' citizens from Haiti
summary: Violent street battles started erupting in Haiti at the end of February. The French Foreign Ministry on Sunday said it would provide special flights to evacuate some of the 1,100 French citizens.

title: White House says Ukraine had 'no involvement whatsoever' in Moscow attack
summary: The White House National Security Council spokesperson made a statement on Sunday after the Russian president failed to acknowledge the Islamic State group's claim of responsibility for Friday's massacre near Moscow.

title: Kyiv's 'thousand cuts' strategy to curb the Russian war machine
summary: After the failure of their counter-offensive in the summer of 2023, and the shift of their troops to a defensive position on almost the entire front, the Ukrainians have opted to multiply actions on the periphery of the battlefield to hinder the enemy's war effort.

title: Unforgettable Benjamin Bernheim and Nadine Sierra in 'Roméo et Juliette' at the New York Metropolitan Opera
summary: The couple formed by the two actors is without doubt the most glamorous imaginable on today's operatic stage.

title: With a second cancer diagnosis, the British royal family has rarely looked so vulnerable
summary: Kate Middleton, Princess of Wales, announced in a video on Friday that she was being treated for an unspecified cancer.

title: Europe's most beautiful campuses: Salamanca, Oxford, Sorbonne, and more
summary: Discover some of Europe's finest universities, from Ireland to Portugal, the UK, Belgium, France and Spain.

title: Ursula von der Leyen is trying to save the world. Does anyone care?
summary: The President of the European Commission visited Cairo on March 17 to forge a global strategic partnership with Abdel Fattah Al-Sissi and to discuss a number of border conflicts.

title: 'Sakura,' cherry blossom time
summary: This year, the cloud of pink petals will spread through parks and gardens from the south to the north of Japan, between March 20 and April 30. A highlight of the year, which florist Tomoji Hakuno is reinterpreting in his Paris flower shop.

title: More than 130 kidnapped Nigerian schoolchildren released two weeks after abduction
summary: Aged between eight and 15, the children were released unharmed on Sunday.

title: Guillaume Faury: 'It is once again legitimate to finance the defense sector'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the Airbus CEO praises the EU's awakening with regard to  armaments, but regrets that political declarations in favor of greater sovereignty are not translating into greater cooperation.

title: The history of Belgian Surrealism is celebrated in two Brussels exhibits
summary: 'No Laughing Matter: Surrealism in Belgium' at the Center for Fine Arts (BOZAR) and 'Imagine! 100 years of International Surrealism' at the Royal Museums of Fine Arts of Belgium show the vitality of the 100-year-old artistic movement.

title: French police use aggressive techniques to stop migrants from crossing English Channel
summary: After months of investigation, Le Monde and its partners have documented many situations in which officers attempted to destabilize, or even sink, the small boats.

title: Transferring UK asylum seekers to Rwanda: inside Sunak's stubborn obsession
summary: After two years of legal wrangling over the inhumanity of the measure, the British prime minister hopes to see the process for transferring irregular migrants to the East African country completed by mid-April, with the first planes taking off as soon as possible.

title: Senegal opposition candidate Faye closing in on victory, but ruling camp contests
summary: At least seven candidates have congratulated Faye, but official results aren't expected before the end of the week.

title: Israeli contractors face the dilemma of the Palestinian workforce
summary: Following the attack on October 7, the cancellation of permits allowing 200,000 workers from the West Bank to enter Israeli territory every day plunged the construction sector into crisis.

title: In Portugal, holding two or three jobs simultaneously is increasingly common
summary: Despite good growth figures and low unemployment, many Portuguese are finding themselves squeezed by low wages, inflation and soaring rent prices. That's forcing them to juggle several jobs to make ends meet.

title: Young Americans are shunning the Biden-Trump rematch
summary: On the campuses of Philadelphia's Community College and Temple Public University, most students are showing little enthusiasm for reliving the presumed duel between the incumbent Democratic president and his Republican predecessor.

title: Macron tells Israel forced displacement of people from Rafah would be 'war crime'
summary: The French President also condemned the seizure of 800 hectares of land in the occupied West Bank, the largest since the Oslo Accords of 1993.

title: In Spain, 'non-normative trans' suspected of sabotaging gender transition law
summary: Grouped together in an association, police officers, military personnel and civil guards have changed their 'sex' in large numbers at the civil registry by a simple declaration, as permitted by a law passed in 2023.

title: Tourcoing and Roubaix celebrate 150 years of Impressionism
summary: The MUba Eugène-Leroy and La Piscine are each welcoming, in their own way, major loans from the Musée d'Orsay, highlighting the prestige of these two museums in northern France.

title: Luigi Ghirri's 'In Scala,' where Italian heritage is writ small
summary: At the end of the 1970s, Ghirri paced the Italia in Miniatura theme park in Rimini, which includes the Tower of Pisa, St. Peter's Square, the Colosseum, and the snowcapped Italian Alps, all of which feature in one of his best-known series 'In Scala' (to scale).

title: Senegal on brink of political earthquake as opposition candidate Faye leads in presidential election
summary: Several candidates have recognized the victory of Bassirou Diomaye Faye, from the main opposition party. Amadou Ba, the ruling party's candidate, said he is certain 'in the worst case scenario' to be in the second round. Official results are expected by Friday.

title: Moscow attack: How Central Asia became the Islamic State organization's new foothold
summary: The jihadist group, which claimed responsibility for Friday night's bloody attack in Russia, has spread to countries north of Afghanistan.

title: Moscow attack: Flaws at the top, a scapegoat abroad
summary: After overlooking warnings of a terrorist threat, Russian authorities are resolute in accusing Ukraine of involvement in the attack on Moscow's Crocus City Hall, in which  144 people were killed. The suspects admitted their guilt after being tortured.

title: Macron's flexed bicep, a tribute to sports or a manly comeback to Putin?
summary: The black-and-white shot of France's head of state in the middle of a boxing sparring session, a display of outdated masculinity, has social media buzzing.

title: Macron says IS branch behind Moscow attack
summary: Macron also told reporters on Monday that the group had made 'several attempts' at attacks on French soil.

title: France and Germany to co-produce military equipment in Ukraine
summary: The KNDS conglomerate, which brings together Germany's KMW and France's Nexter Systems, will produce spare parts, ammunition and, eventually, complete weapons systems.

title: Michel Talagrand, an unlikely mathematical superstar: 'I wanted to take risks'
summary: At 72, the scientist is the fifth Frenchman to receive the Abel Prize. This specialist in probability looks back on his chaotic career the day after receiving his prestigious award on Wednesday.

title: Several injured in Russian missile attack on Kyiv
summary: The attack came after almost a dozen people were wounded in a Russian drone strike on southern Ukraine overnight.

title: Boeing announces CEO Dave Calhoun to step down
summary: The troubled aircraft company also announced its board chairman would exit.

title: From 'Navalny' to 'Hollywoodgate,' producer Odessa Rae is at the center of global geopolitics
summary: After winning an Oscar in 2023 for her documentary on the struggle of the Russian opposition figure who died in February, the Canadian is working on a series of committed projects in Ukraine and Gaza.

title: As Macron visits French Guiana, local officials call for autonomy
summary: The French president is visiting the overseas territory on the South American continent. Local elected officials expect a constitutional revision to give their local government more autonomy, as has been promised to Corsica.

title: Gaza: UN Security Council for first time demands 'immediate' ceasefire, US abstains
summary: The resolution calls for a ceasefire during Ramadan and for the release of all hostages taken captive during Hamas' October 7 attack in Israel.

title: Senegal: Ruling party's presidential candidate concedes to anti-establishment Faye
summary: Former prime minister Amadou Ba conceded defeat to Bassirou Diomaye Faye, the right-hand man of former president Macky Sall's main opponent, Ousmane Sonko.

title: Paleontologist Delphine Angst: 'The dodo was neither stupid, obese nor maladjusted'
summary: On the occasion of the reconstitution of a pair of these birds, exhibited at the Paris Museum National d'Histoire Naturelle, the scientist explains the difficulties involved in studying them.

title: NY court lowers Trump's bond to $175M in civil fraud judgment
summary: Donald Trump won a request to reduce his $454 million bond, on the day it was due. He now has 10 days to put up $175 million to prevent the state from starting to seize his assets.

title: Ukrainian police evacuate villages bordering Russia
summary: The Russian army, in response to incursions into its territory by Ukraine-aligned commandos, has relentlessly bombarded the border region near the Ukrainian city of Sumy.

title: Trump's hush money trial date set for April 15
summary: Donald Trump's Manhattan trial on charges of paying pre-election hush money to the porn star Stormy Daniels had been delayed as the defense asked for time to examine a last-minute document dump.

title: Tuberculosis: Millions of undiagnosed cases jeopardize control efforts
summary: The WHO estimates that in 2022, 3 million new cases went undetected by health services. People with few or no symptoms could account for a significant proportion of these, and diagnosis is particularly difficult in children.
